thread.title: SA Severe weather advice issued at 5:21pm CDT
thread.title_full: SA Severe weather advice issued at 5:21pm CDT

title: SA Severe weather advice issued at 5:21pm CDT
text: Severe Weather Warning for SA Weather Warnings - Severe Weather Warning for SA   MeteorologySouth Australia Regional OfficeTOP PRIORITY FOR IMMEDIATE BROADCASTSEVERE WEATHER WARNINGIssued at 5:20 pm Monday, 20 March 2017.A low pressure trough, currently located near Hawker to Nuriootpa to Lameroo,will drift southeast and strengthen overnight.This system will generate areas of rain over the Lower South East with totals of10 to 40 mm forecast. Locally heavier falls in excess of 40 mm are possible,particularly with thunderstorms, and flash flooding may occur. Most of this rainis expected between midnight and 10 am Tuesday.Locations which may be affected include Mount Gambier, Naracoorte, Kingston,Robe and Millicent. The State Emergency Service advises that people should: * Don't drive, ride or walk through flood water; * Keep clear of creeks and storm drains; * Stay indoors, away from windows, while conditions are severe. The next Severe Weather Warning will be issued by 11:00 pm ACDT Monday.Warnings are also available through TV and Radio broadcasts, the Bureau'swebsite at www.bom.gov.au or call 1300 659 215. The Bureau and State EmergencyService would appreciate warnings being broadcast regularly. Go!
